intro: Rydbergiella scaphoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, succulent stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its adaptations to harsh environments include reduced leaf surface area and water-storing tissues.
